sub_title: Cost Estimating & Risk | Innovator | Sterk in techniek, kosten & commercie | Energie projecten | Hardlopen | Muziek
summary:
Civiel Ingenieur, veelzijdig en met sterke kanten in de volgende gebieden:
•	Technisch (offshore installatie, design en built projecten, Front End design, en Detail Design)
•	Kosten aspecten (Estimaten en Budgetteren voor tenders en projecten)
•	Commercieel (Tender Manager)
•	Organisatie (en aansturen, organiseren, en optimaliseren van teams en departementen)

Mijn drijfveren zijn een drang naar creativiteit en verbetering, en loyaliteit aan de mensen en de organisatie waarmee ik samenwerk.

Ik ben vasthoudend en resultaat gericht en ik werk graag in een organisatie die mij een zekere vrijheid geeft om doelen op mijn manier te bereiken.

Ik heb verschillende uitdagingen gekregen, die door daar “ja” tegen te zeggen, elke keer weer interessante openingen bleken naar nieuwe werkgebieden en inzichten, en waar ik motiverende mensen ontmoette van over de hele wereld.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the reorganization and improvement of the Cost Engineering department, and for the Cost Engineering team development, including: 
- Transition of an old fashioned hard copy oriented organization to a modern SharePoint based form of cooperation
- Cost Estimating software development to enable quick estimation of complex projects in a detailed manner, meeting all stakeholder requirements 
- Supporting cost estimating for 60 to 70 tenders per year, from small to large, including the multi billion Kaombo Lump Sum SURF EPIC project for Total
profile_positions.title: Cost - Manager Tender Cost Engineering

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the Detailed Design of “Flow lines and Risers” for the SURF EPIC Block 31 – PSVM project for BP, executed by IntecSea and 2H in London. This project was executed in 2 kilometre water depth offshore Angola, and concerned the design and build of an insulated pipeline system for the production of oil and gas. In this role I experienced the logic relations between Design, Procurement, and Construction
profile_positions.title: Technical - Engineering Manager EPCI

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the development and negotiation of tenders for Offshore Installation projects for (major) Oil companies and Main Contractors like Daewoo. In this role I led negotiation teams for Technical, Contractual, and Commercial meetings with Clients. In addition I led the tender teams to complete stage gate activities like Risk reviews. Interesting tenders included: 
- Perdido facilities installation for Shell, including a pipeline network, a 11,000 ton topsides, and a anchored and ballasted “Spar” (floating foundation) in the Gulf of Mexico in 2,500 meter water depth 
- Independence pipeline network and floating production facility installation for Anadarko in the Gulf of Mexico in 2,500 meter water depth 
- Rosa Lirio modules installation for Total on the Girassol FPSO offshore Angola 
Tahiti Spar and 19,000 ton Topsides installation for Chevron in the Gulf of Mexico in 1,100 meter water depth 
- Constitution Spar and Topsides installation for Kerr-McGee in 1,500 meter water depth, featuring a first time ever “driven piles” in such deep waters 
- Benguela Belize compliant tower installation together with Daewoo (Korea) for Chevron, comprising a 40,000 ton oil and gas production topsides on a 30,000 ton tower in 390 meter water depth offshore Angola
profile_positions.title: Commercial - Tender Manager, Section Head Tender Coordination, Tender Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Project Engineer for Offshore Installation projects and tender support; among which the Marlin TLP project in Texas for Amoco in “alliance” with ABB, Kiwit and Vetco Gray. Interesting project phases were: 
- Transport and Installation of driven piles in 1,000 meter water depth 
- Installation of tendons, suspended from temporary buoys 
- Installation of the TLP facility over the tendons (“ratcheting”) 
- Pick-up and hang-off of Steel Catenary Risers by an anchored crane vessel
profile_positions.title: Technical - Sr. Project Engineer

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the engineering office in Kuala Lumpur and the preparations for the Jintan project for Occidental. I developed and led a multi-cultural engineering team comprising of Engineers from the three major cultural dimension in Malaysia (being Malay, Chinese, and Indian) and Dutch (expat) engineers
profile_positions.title: Technical - Engineering Manager

profile_positions.description:
Project Engineer for various projects, among which a Framework agreement for Maersk for a list of Installation projects in the German Bight; the Front End Engineering Design for the Baydaratska bay crossing for Gazprom (executed with Willbros – Butler); various Installation projects for British Gas in the Irish sea, In this role I had daily contact with the Client and their partners, to make the projects a success for both. I found the following subjects of particular interest: 
- Cooperation with the Danes (various Client departments and other Contractors) and the running of various subprojects in parallel, sometimes there were six simultaneous subprojects in preparation 
- Working together with Russians and Ukrainians (Gazprom), Americans (Willbros-Butler), Canadians (Agra), Fins (YIT), and Belgians (Denys and Jan de Nul) for one project in Siberia above the polar circle 
- Developing a feasible alternative for the impossible (but contractually required) combination of Dynamic Positioning and Anchoring of a very large semisubmersible crane vessel (being the “DB-102” featuring two 7000 ton cranes)
profile_positions.title: Technical - Sr. Project Engineer, Project Engineer, and Installation Engineer

Dredging Engineer and Superintendent for dredging projects in Zeeland and Iraq. Project Engineer for the Peconor – Ekofisk barrier Lump Sum Design and Build contract for the following subprojects: 
- “Dock Float-out” of the bottom 12 meter of two half cylinders of 140 meter in diameter out of the dry dock of Verolme in Rotterdam 
- “River Transport” of the half cylinders (“macaroni’s”) over the “Nieuwe Waterweg” to the “achtste Petroleum haven” for load-out onto a heavy transport vessel for the voyage to Norway 
- “Inshore Ballast” with gravel for a safe and stable tow to the offshore location 
- “Offshore Fixed Ballast” of the eventual 115 meter high cylinder standing on the seabed, to assure survival in winter storm conditions; in addition I optimized the execution for the advantage of Peconor, the work was contracted on “Unit Rates” conditions
